body.description: Product Description The Fisher-Price See ‘n Say The Farmer Says is a classic learning toy that teaches kids fun facts about 16 different animals. To start the learning fun, just select a page and then turn the arrow to select an animal and pull the lever to hear the Farmer speak. There is also a quiz mode for more learning fun. It's a great way to learn words and animals, too! Plays “Old MacDonald” and “Farmer in the Dell” melodies. From the Manufacturer This classic learning toy is better than ever! Shaped like a barn, it teaches kids fun facts about 16 different animals. To start the learning fun, just select a page and then turn the arrow to select an animal and pull the lever to hear the Farmer speak. There is also a quiz mode for more learning fun. It's a great way to learn words and animals, too! Plays "Old MacDonald" and "Farmer in the Dell" melodies. Requires 3 AA batteries.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Fisher-Price See 'n Say The Farmer Says This classic learning toy is better than ever! Shaped like a barn, it teaches kids fun facts about 16 different animals. To start the learning fun, just select a page and then turn the arrow to select an animal and pull the lever to hear the Farmer speak. There is also a quiz mode for more learning fun. It's a great way to learn words and animals, too! Plays 'Old MacDonald' and 'Farmer in the Dell' melodies. Requires 3 AA batteries. Features Classic See 'n Say play-turn the arrow and pull the lever! 2 Ways to play Animal Identification and Quiz modes Fun facts and sounds from 16 different animals Plays 'Old MacDonald' and 'Farmer in the Dell' melodies

Fisher-Price For the Best Possible Start To give your child the best possible start in life, you don't have to have all the answers or do things a certain way. All you have to do is the best you can, and let our kids play. At Fisher-Price toys are made to help all kids-from infants to toddler to preschoolers- develop through p[lay, in their own ways, because that's how they learn best at each age and stage. And for babies, our gear offers simple solutions (more sleep, anyone?!) you can't possibly parent without. Making Learning Fun in 1965, Mattel released the original See 'n Say toy, The Farmer Says. The fun and innovation of that first talking learning toy live on with the new See 'n Say The Farmers Says. With electronic sounds and multiple pages of play, learning is more fun than ever. Develop & Grow Children love animals, and The Farmer Says engages children by providing colorful images and sounds of animals. Children will enjoy hearing sounds from and fun facts about their favorite animals as well as discovering new animals. The Farmer Says encourages learning through repetition and memory. As children learn to identify the animals, they are rewarded by hearing their favorite sounds. More Features Helps teach words and object identification. Multiple pages of play Electronic sounds Requires 3 AA batteries
More ways to play! The Farmer Says now includes two pages of paly for more fun learning. Just turn the page to switch from Identification to Quiz modes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Learning & Playtime Toy
reviews.reviewText: You just can’t go wrong with Fischer Price toys. I bought them for my children, and now for my granddaughter. Great durability, educational and fun.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Started playing with it as soon as they got it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works well, smaller than expected, and should have more music.
reviews.reviewText: This thing reminds me of the one I had as a kid. I like that it flips and offers lots of sounds. I wish there were more songs as that's what my daughter loves, but we'll make due. There are two songs, one on each "page." Some of the sounds are a little annoying, but so are all the sounds and songs on these toys after you're heard them 2 million times. My daughter was excited the first time she got it to work on her own by pulling the handle all the way back. For those purchasing based on owning one of the old school versions, keep in mind that this thing is about 1/2 the size of the one we probably all remember. The good side to this is that you can easily bring it with you in the car.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It got smaller since 90s. But still great toy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars They Totally Ruined This Classic Toy
reviews.reviewText: Wow, this thing is garbage. I ordered it on sale as a Christmas gift for a 2-year-old. The box was unusually small, which I opened to find this poor excuse for a toy that I cannot believe Fisher Price puts its name on. This "updated" toy is less than half the size of the classic toy, which makes it look very cheap and feel insubstantial. There is no pull string anymore, now it is a lever on the side that the child pulls down. Except the small size of the toy makes it very awkward and I can't imagine a 2 or 3-year-old having the patience to try to hold this tiny thing while pulling the side lever. But even if the child can pull it off, the dealbreaker is the lever is so darn loud and the noise is so prolonged that it drowns out the sounds that the toy makes. And there is no volume control, so the average to quiet audio chip playback is nearly impossible to hear, especially at the beginning when they announce the animal. This is such an obvious design flaw--which I'm guessing is because the old toy was a taped recording powered by the string mechanism (no batteries needed) that played seamlessly AFTER you released the string, while these new ones have an audio chip (batteries required) that starts the sound clip way too soon after you pull the incredibly noisy lever--that I really can't believe any child plays with this toy or that anyone paying attention would ever bother gifting this junk to a child.Back in the box and I'm returning it tomorrow. Shame on you, Fisher Price.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Disappointed in size and functions Doesn’t point to the animal the pointer lands on along with its lever that is to loud and can’t hear the sound of the animal. It’s a waste of money and now I’m kinda weary in buying any other Fisher toy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for kids

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024

reviews.reviewText: Cheaply made, not like the ones we had as a kid. It's small and really fragile.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 27, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: It says "Greek" but the Farmer speaks "Engligh"!
reviews.reviewText: Very disappointed! I bought this toy for my son since he is bilingual and expected the toy to be in Greek, as stated in the title of the posting, instead it came and it is all in English...I would send it back but it's such a process since I live in the US.

Trying to recapture the joy of our 60’s era toy for my grandson. The lever is difficult for him to push down all the way. A little hard to hear over the turning of the mechanism. All in all, he enjoys it!

I was eagerly anticipating giving this toy to my grandson as I and my siblings had so much fun with it years (yes many years) ago. I am sorely disappointed in what is now on offer as the see and say. It is a prime example of "shrinkflation" as it is much smaller than what I remembered even taking into account the adult vs child memories. That itself was not what disappointed me - the toy makes so much noise when turning the pointer you can not hear what the toy is "saying" about the animal it was pointing to. It does not live up to memories or expectations!! I would give it a miss!

reviews.reviewTitle: Sweet little gift, entertains the kids!
reviews.reviewText: My brother was gifted this YEARS ago and I was so happy to source one for my own littles. It's exactly as I remembered and my kids love it! They love to pick an animal and listen to the sound. It is as described. The lever is a bit hard for the kids to pull back, but they like the challenge and are figuring it out.
